messages.message:
Hello, with flake8 we are now starting to remove unused imports.

This causes problem with celery registration functions, where the registration functions are declared in a separate module.

In the cases described above, the modules are imported into tasks.py such that celery registration functions can be run.  (These functions run during the module initialization time).  As such, you’ll not see these functions being used anywhere.

There might be other places where such operations are performed, for example Aaron V might have been trying to do very similar operations with NLPAction registrations.

Please make sure to double check removal of imports.
Can we remove those files from being flake8 'ed
yes, in a meeting, will get back soon. in line `noqa ` can be used. will put exact string soon.
Maybe let's add these files to the excludes list though

There are two options here:
1. *Ignore the entire file*: Add the file to exclude here: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml

2. *Ignore one particular line for  flake8 check*: In this case add `# noqa: F401` to the line.
where
`F401` is the error code for unused import as mentioned here: http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/3.1.1/user/error-codes.html
@shaunak Feel free to take the right approach, thanks for pointing it out, i will send an email to all soon.
Yep sg. I think we should ignore the entire file since removing those unused functions is risky at the entire file level
Yes, that is the preferable approach
can we get a list of the files? i made changes to registry/tasks.py and not sure which imports are needed and which aren’t
@Mohit — can you help with creating that regex to prevent those files from being touched. maybe for now we can just default to “tasks.py” being ignored
@Jonathan Shih after :point_up_2: is merged, you wont have to worry about `tasks.py`
